titleStmt.title: The Presbyterian lash. Or, Noctroff's maid whipt. A tragy-comedy. As it was lately acted in the great roome at the Pye Tavern at Algate. By Noctroffe the priest, and severall his parishoners at the eating of a chine of beefe. The first part.
titleStmt.author: Kirkman, Francis, 1632-ca. 1680.

titleStmt.title: The Presbyterian lash. Or, Noctroff's maid whipt. A tragy-comedy. As it was lately acted in the great roome at the Pye Tavern at Algate. By Noctroffe the priest, and severall his parishoners at the eating of a chine of beefe. The first part.
titleStmt.author: Kirkman, Francis, 1632-ca. 1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the use of Mr. Noctroffs friends, and are to be sold at the Pye at Algate,

notesStmt.note: Dedication signed: K.F., i.e. Francis Kirkman.
Quire B is in two settings; B1r signed (1) C or (2) B.
In part, a lampoon of Perjury the proof of forgery, a defense of Zachary Crofton which was written by Crofton under the pseudonym Alethes Noctroff.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the use of Mr. Noctroffs friends
